Irani said that in collaboration with Women's Helplines, about 70 lakh women have been helped by the Central and state governments so far.

175.title: Viral video shows 20 electric scooters on fire in Maharashtra
175.article_body: A video showing around 20 electric scooters of Jitendra EV on fire in Maharashtra's Nashik is going viral on social media. The video shows fire department officials trying to douse the fire in the container truck that was transporting around 40 scooters. The exact cause of fire is yet to be ascertained by the authorities.

176.title: Air India plane damaged as tow tractor collides with it at Delhi airport
176.article_body: A Guwahati-bound Air India plane was damaged after a tow tractor collided with its nose while pushing it back for take-off at the Delhi airport on Tuesday, senior DGCA officials said. No one was injured in the incident and the 182-seater aircraft was grounded for inspection. Aviation regulator DGCA has initiated an investigation into the incident, officials added.

177.title: People seen lying on ground and bleeding after being shot at Brooklyn station
177.article_body: After mass shooting at a train station in US' Brooklyn on Tuesday, pictures showing people lying on the station and train floor and bleeding have surfaced online. At least 13 persons were injured, including five from gunshots, at the station. The suspect reportedly escaped the spot and was wearing a construction vest and a gas mask.

178.title: US cannot confirm use of chemical weapons in Ukraine: Official
178.article_body: After Ukraine claimed it is investigating unverified information that Russia may have used chemical weapons in Mariupol, a US defence official said that America cannot confirm the use of chemical agents in the city at this time. The US had no information to support the movement of chemical agents by Russia in or near Ukraine, the official added.

179.title: Awestruck: Axar recalls his and Bumrah's reaction on joining MI in IPL 2013
179.article_body: Recalling his and Jasprit Bumrah's reaction after joining MI in IPL 2013, Axar Patel, who currently represents DC, said both of them were awestruck after seeing Sachin Tendulkar, Rohit Sharma and other players in MI. He added that they were left wondering on what should they do as all "big stars" they used to see on television were present there.

180.title: Electoral bond one of the biggest scams in Indian democracy: Gehlot
180.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday described electoral bond scheme as "one of the biggest scams in Indian democracy", adding that it swings election process in favour of ruling party at Centre. Gehlot alleged that BJP puts pressure on industrialists to obtain donations through electoral bonds. "These bonds are becoming a way to use black money in elections," he added.

181.title: Man who threatened to kill Spain PM Sanchez jailed for 7.5 years
181.article_body: Spain's High Court on Tuesday sentenced a 65-year-old man to seven-and-a-half years in prison for threatening to assassinate Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on a far-right WhatsApp chat in 2018 and possessing illegal guns. Manuel Murillo Sanchez was sentenced to two-and-a-half years for attempted murder and five years for possession of war weapons.

182.title: British MP found guilty of sexually assaulting 15-year-old boy
182.article_body: British MP Imran Ahmad Khan on Monday was found guilty of sexually assaulting a 15-year-old boy after trying to force him to drink alcohol at a house in 2008. Khan, 48, had denied the allegation. Khan has since been suspended by Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservative Party while waiting for the outcome of the trial.

183.title: One producer told me I don't have looks to be an actor: Vivek Oberoi
183.article_body: Vivek Oberoi, who completed 20 years in Bollywood on Tuesday, recalled his early acting days and revealed that a producer once told him that he doesn't have the looks to be an actor. "I was really hurt," Vivek added. The actor further said, "I wanted a job on my own merit rather than my last name...and struggled for 18-29 months."

184.title: All options on the table: UK warns if Russia uses chemical weapons
184.article_body: British Armed Forces Minister James Heappey on Tuesday warned "all possible options are on the table" on how the West would respond if Russia used chemical weapons in Ukraine. "These are appalling weapons to think about using," he said. Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said the UK "will hold Putin and his regime to account" if chemical weapons are used.

185.title: Politician indicted on charge of insulting Thai King Maha Vajiralongkorn
185.article_body: Thai politician Thanathorn Juangroongruangkit was indicted on Monday on charges of insulting King Maha Vajiralongkorn and violating a cyber law. Juangroongruangkit, who now faces up to 20 years in prison, had criticised government last year for awarding contract of COVID-19 vaccines to a company owned by the King. He was granted release on bail of 90,000 baht (over ₹2 lakh).

186.title: Formation of Supertech's Committee of Creditors stayed till April 19
186.article_body: National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has stayed the formation of the Committee of Creditors in the Supertech insolvency case till April 19 as the real estate developer sought time to negotiate with banks. NCLAT has taken into consideration the concerns of all stakeholders, including homebuyers, said Ram Kishor Arora, the petitioner and director of the suspended board of Supertech.

187.title: I’ve got a car that is capable of winning: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc
187.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc said he has "a car that is capable of winning" following his victory at the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. "I know that it's in the car and I just have to do the job, so the mindset is a little bit different this year," Leclerc said. The 24-year-old currently leads the Driver Standings with 71 points.

188.title: Head of Russian artillery intelligence killed in Ukraine: Reports
188.article_body: The head of Russia's artillery intelligence has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Lieutenant Colonel Vyacheslav Savinov, 40, reportedly died last month in a fierce battle. Savinov was the deputy chief of staff of the Russian Missile Troops and Artillery. He is the 32nd Russian lieutenant colonel or colonel to be killed. Seven Russian generals have also reportedly been killed.

189.title: Currently focussed on IPL, hopeful to play for India one day: PBKS' Vaibhav
189.article_body: PBKS pacer Vaibhav Arora said he's currently focussed on playing in IPL, adding he wants to work on his form and give best results. "Haven't thought a lot about my future plans but if I continue with my good performance then one day hopefully I'll play for India," he added. Vaibhav has taken two wickets from two matches so far.

190.title: I'm not a man for predictions: Karthik on RCB's chances of winning IPL 2022
190.article_body: On being asked about his views on RCB's chances of winning IPL 2022, RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik replied, "(Laughs) I'm not a man for predictions. But I must say the mood in the camp is good." He added, "We are (heading) in a good direction." RCB are currently third in standings, having won three from four matches.

191.title: Poland takes over Russian compound in Warsaw to give to Ukrainians
191.article_body: A fenced compound in Poland's Warsaw, which was "unlawfully occupied" by Russians, will be made available for Ukrainian refugees, Mayor Rafal Trzaskowski said on Monday. The compound, which consists of several empty buildings, was built in a land-swap agreement between Soviet Union and Poland in 1970s and was considered disputed. Trzaskowski, however, added that the compound has been recovered.

192.title: People of Punjab will soon get good news: CM Bhagwant Mann
192.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said his government will soon give "good news" to the people of the state, indicating that it could announce 300 units of free electricity to households. The Opposition criticised AAP earlier today and alleged that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was trying to control the Punjab government through remote control.

193.title: CSK record highest total of IPL 2022, break DC's record
193.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) put up a total of 216/4 against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on Tuesday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far. The previous highest total in IPL 2022 was 215/5, which was recorded by Delhi Capitals (DC) against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). Shivam Dube top-scored for CSK with 95*(46), while Robin Uthappa scored 88(50).

194.title: 403 bodies found in Ukraine's Bucha after Russian retreat: Mayor
194.article_body: The Mayor of Bucha in Ukraine, Anatoliy Fedoruk, on Tuesday said that 403 bodies of people have been found in the town so far, following a retreat by Russian forces last month. Ukraine has accused Russian forces of killing civilians during their occupation of Bucha. Fedoruk claimed that it was too early for residents to return to the town.

195.title: I was taken to a nude couple after being intoxicated: Woman on sex racket in Delhi spa
195.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was rescued by Delhi Commission for Women and Delhi Police from a sex racket allegedly being operated inside a spa centre in Azadpur, Delhi. "She informed...she was given...intoxicant after which she started losing her senses...She was taken inside a room where there was a nude couple," a notice said. She alleged someone tried to rape her.

196.title: Gangrape survivor in PoK seeks PM Modi's help, says, 'allow us to come to India'
196.article_body: A gangrape survivor in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir has sought PM Narendra Modi's help in a video message that is being circulated online. Stating that she has been fighting for justice for past seven years, the woman said, "Allow us to come to India...The local police and a senior politician, Choudhary Tariq Farooq, will anytime kill me and my children."

197.title: Video of Brooklyn mass shooting surfaces, smoke seen inside train
197.article_body: A video from the site of the mass shooting in New York's Brooklyn has shown smoke pouring out of a train and commuters running away from it. At least 13 people were injured, including five from being shot at, at a Brooklyn subway station on Tuesday. Reports had suggested a possible explosion had occurred at the site of the attack.

198.title: Robin Uthappa records most sixes in an innings in IPL 2022
198.article_body: CSK opener Robin Uthappa on Tuesday recorded the most sixes in an innings in IPL 2022 so far. The 36-year-old slammed nine sixes against RCB, overtaking KKR all-rounder Andre Russell, who had slammed eight sixes against PBKS on April 1. Uthappa scored 88 runs off 50 deliveries, his highest-ever score in IPL.

199.title: Ropeway was shaking, passengers screamed: Tribals on J'khand cable car accident
199.article_body: Some tribals who rescued eight tourists from two cable cars after a ropeway accident in Jharkhand's Deoghar district shared what they saw at the time of the incident. A local said he heard a loud thud and the ropeway was shaking violently and the passengers were screaming. "I found panic-stricken people, including two girls, screaming inside the trolleys," he added.

200.title: If oil prices remain above $110 a barrel, burden will have to be shared: CEA
200.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor Dr V Anantha Nageswaran said if global crude oil prices remain above $110 per barrel for more than a quarter, then the burden will have to be shared by the government, oil marketing companies and consumers. He told CNBC-TV18, "The burden needs to be shared because this is a global supply shock...It hasn't been engineered by anyone."

201.title: Man held with 1.3 kg charas worth lakhs of rupees in J&K's Poonch
201.article_body: An alleged drug peddler was arrested in the Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir, police said on Tuesday. About 1.3 kilograms of charas, which is estimated to be worth lakhs of rupees, was also recovered from his possession. According to the police, he was intercepted on Monday after a police party found him moving suspiciously during patrolling.

202.title: Elephant kills Colombian researcher in Ugandan national park
202.article_body: A Colombian researcher, Sebastian Ramirez Amaya, was trampled to death by an elephant on Sunday in Uganda's Kibale National Park, according to Ugandan authorities. Amaya was researching a doctorate on the social lives of male and female chimpanzees. Notably, Amaya's death comes three months after a Saudi tourist was killed by an elephant in another national park in the country.

203.title: FIFA launch new digital streaming service, to include live games
203.article_body: FIFA has launched a new digital streaming service called FIFA+ which will include free live games and "Netflix style" documentaries. "This project represents a cultural shift in the way different types of football fans want to connect with and explore the global game," FIFA President Gianni Infantino said. The new platform will be funded by advertisers.

204.title: Peace talks with Ukraine are at a dead end: Russian President Putin
204.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday said that peace talks with Ukraine are "at a dead end". This is the first time Putin addressed the war in public since Russian forces retreated from northern Ukraine after they were halted at the gates of Kyiv. Putin promised that Russia would achieve all of its "noble" aims in Ukraine.

205.title: You have to quickly move on: Bumrah to Sams after his 35-run over vs KKR
205.article_body: MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah said teammate Daniel Sams is an experienced cricketer and understands that he needs to "quickly" move on from the match against KKR as he conceded 35 runs in one over. He added that in T20 cricket anybody can get hit but it's important that one shouldn't carry the baggage going further because there are back-to-back matches.

206.title: Goa CM allots portfolios to 3 new ministers, Dhavalikar gets Power dept
206.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant allotted portfolios to newly-inducted ministers Ramkrishna alias Sudin Dhavalikar, Nilkanth Halarnkar and Subhash Phal Dessai on Tuesday. Dhavalikar has been given the Power, New and Renewable Energy and Housing portfolios, while Halarnkar will handle Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Factories departments. Dessai has been given Social Welfare and two other departments.

207.title: UEFA orders Atletico Madrid to partially close stadium for Man City game
207.article_body: UEFA has ordered Atletico Madrid to partially close their stadium for their Champions League second-leg quarter-final match against Manchester City after being punished for the behaviour of their fans during the first-leg in Manchester. Two charges for discriminatory behaviour and throwing objects was initiated on Friday. Manchester City won the first-leg clash 1-0.

208.title: US retail inflation rose 8.5% in FY22, highest since 1981
208.article_body: Retail inflation in the US rose 8.5% in FY22, its highest level since 1981, and rose 1.2% in March 2022, the highest since 2005. Increase in prices of gasoline, food and housing contributed the most to rise in retail inflation in March. While gasoline prices rose 48% in FY22, food and housing inflation rose 8.8% and 5% respectively.

209.title: Baap, baap hota hai: Abhishek to fan who said he is now more famous than Big B
209.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan has reacted to a fan's tweet who praised the actor's work in 'Dasvi'. The Twitter user had written, "After this movie, looking at Amitabh Bachchan people will say, 'See that man, he is Abhishek's father'."  Replying to this, Abhishek wrote, "Thank you for the compliment but...Never! Baap, baap hota hai (father is after all a father)."

210.title: It’s going to be a big task: Red Bull's Verstappen on F1 title defence
210.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen said it will be a big task to defend his title this season. Red Bull's Verstappen suffered a second retirement in three races at the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. "We are already miles behind so I don't even want to think about the championship fight at the moment," the 24-year-old said.

211.title: Had fear of getting pregnant: Amrita on getting anxiety attack while conceiving
211.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao has revealed that she had a fear of getting pregnant. "Women around me used to tell me that the whole process is natural and all," she stated. "But a baby is developing in your body and thinking about this caused me discomfort," she added. Amrita further said that she got an anxiety attack while trying to conceive.

212.title: Mumbai court grants bail to 3 accused in 'Bulli Bai' app case
212.article_body: A court in Mumbai on Tuesday granted bail to three students arrested in the 'Bulli Bai' app case. Magistrate KC Rajput of Bandra court granted bail to Vishal Kumar Jha, Shweta Singh and Mayank Agarwal. Previously, both the Magistrate and sessions court had denied them bail, but the three filed their pleas again after the police submitted a charge sheet.

213.title: Things will get better for CSK if Dhoni is back as captain: RP Singh
213.article_body: Ex-India cricketer RP Singh has said if MS Dhoni is re-appointed as CSK captain then things will get better for the defending champions as they've lost four consecutive matches in ongoing IPL. "There are problems in both batting and bowling. It doesn't happen often that CSK changes its playing XI after just two-three games and changes batting order," he added.

214.title: Prez Biden briefed on New York City subway shooting: White House
214.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Tuesday said that US President Joe Biden has been briefed on the latest developments regarding New York City subway shooting. White House senior staff are in touch with Mayor Eric Adams and Police Commissioner Keechant Sewell to offer any assistance as needed, she added. At least 13 people were injured in the shooting.

215.title: Russia's economy set for biggest contraction since 1994: Report
215.article_body: Russia's economy is on track to contract by over 10% in 2022, said Alexei Kudrin, who served as Russia's Finance Minister from 2000 to 2011. A contraction of 10% would be the biggest decline in GDP since 1994, according to World Bank and IMF data, Reuters reported. World Bank this month forecast Russian GDP output would fall 11.2% this year.

216.title: Punjab govt directs pvt schools to list shops selling books, uniforms
216.article_body: Under the direction of Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, the state education department has ordered the private schools of the state to share the list of books and uniform shops with the District Education Officers (DEOs). According to an official release, the schools have also been ordered not to force the parents to buy books and uniforms from any specific shop.

217.title: 4 win bronze in India's best performance at European Girls' Mathematical Olympiad
217.article_body: All four contestants who represented India at the 11th European Girls' Mathematical Olympiad held in Hungary during April 6-12 have won bronze medals. Pune's Ananya Rajas Ranade, Delhi's Anushka Aggarwal and Gunjan Aggarwal, and Nashik's Sanika Borade won the medals. It marks India's best performance to date and the first time India has come in the top 20 countries.

218.title: Punjab, other states go to Delhi to understand CM's governance: AAP
218.article_body: Hours after the Opposition alleged that the Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was ruling Punjab through a "remote control", AAP leaders said that Punjab, other states go to Delhi to understand Kejriwal's model of governance. "Arvind Kejriwal is our party's national convenor. We take his guidance so there is nothing wrong with that," the party leaders were quoted as saying.

219.title: Rise above caste & religion: Vice President Naidu tells students
219.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Tuesday advised the youth to rise above "narrow considerations such as caste, religion and region". Naidu, who made these remarks at an interaction with some Telugu students from Delhi University, added that one cannot be a leader if they're not tolerant. He also reiterated the importance of protecting and promoting one's mother tongue.

220.title: I've got an idea for something, I'm hopefully going to direct: Daniel
220.article_body: Daniel Radcliffe said he'll "hopefully" be making a directorial debut in a "couple of years". "I've got an idea for something that I've written," he stated. "It'll be in a couple of years' time, because the next 18 months...are pretty much accounted for already," he further said. Daniel added he would just direct the project and not star in it.

221.title: We are in transition phase: Bumrah after MI's 4 losses in 4 games
221.article_body: Following MI's four losses in four matches in IPL 2022, MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah said his side is going through a transition phase as they've got some new players in the mega auction. "We've got some old core group, some of them, as well, but a lot of new guys who are understanding the team...franchise...how the scenarios work," he stated.

222.title: I'm not at fault: K'taka Minister as contractor blames him in suicide note
222.article_body: Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa has claimed that he wasn't responsible for the suicide of contractor Santosh Patil who has blamed him for his death in a note. "We have to wait for the verdict...in the case I had filed against Patil. I make it very clear that I'm not at fault anywhere," Eshwarappa said. Patil had accused him of corruption.

223.title: Mastercard files 15 metaverse, NFT related trademark applications
223.article_body: Mastercard has filed 15 metaverse and NFT-related trademark applications with the US Patent and Trademark Office. The applications include trademarks for virtual cards and payments in the metaverse and an application to create an NFT marketplace. "We are continually looking for opportunities to deliver new and unique experiences to our customers and cardholders," a Mastercard spokesperson said.

224.title: Contractors can't work if harassed: Kharge on K'taka contractor's death
224.article_body: Congress’ Mallikarjun Kharge said on Tuesday that Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai should take action on the suicide of contractor Santosh Patil. "Contractors...take loans to complete their work, if ministers keep harassing them, they will not be able to work," Kharge added. Patil, who had accused Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa of corruption, died by suicide at a lodge in Udupi.

225.title: ED summons ex-Xiaomi India MD in foreign funding probe: Report
225.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned ex-Xiaomi India MD MK Jain to probe if the firm's business practices complied with Indian foreign exchange laws, Reuters reported citing sources. A Xiaomi spokesperson said the firm was "fully compliant with all the regulations". ED is looking into existing business structures between Xiaomi India, its contract manufacturers and its parent entity in China.

226.title: UP rape convict who jumped parole held after 33 years from Delhi
226.article_body: A rape convict from Uttar Pradesh's Hathras district who had jumped parole has been arrested after 33 years from Delhi's Sant Nagar. The convict, 56-year-old Raghunandan Singh, was living under a fake identity with his wife and worked at a garment retail outlet. Hathras Superintendent of Police Vineet Jaiswal said he had announced a reward of ₹25,000 on Singh's arrest.

227.title: Australian Minister flies to Solomon Islands for talks on China pact
227.article_body: Australia's Minister for the Pacific, Zed Seselja, will arrive in Solomon Islands on Tuesday to discuss a proposed security pact between the Pacific island nation and China. A draft version of the pact was leaked last month. Australia and the US have reacted with concern to the agreement that would allow China to deploy its military in the region.

228.title: No active explosive devices at Brooklyn train station: Police on mass shooting
228.article_body: After at least 13 people were reportedly injured in a mass shooting at a train station in New York's Brooklyn, the city's police department NYPD said there were currently no active explosive devices at the scene. This came after reports said unexploded devices were also found at the site of the attack. "Please stay clear of the area," said NYPD.

229.title: BJP's rigging crossed limits in UP Legislative Council polls: Yadav
229.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said that BJP's rigging crossed all limits in Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council polls. "The BJP has no faith in the Constitution, democracy and the process of fair elections. It is trying to weaken constitutional institutions in order to remain in power by means of money and deceit," Yadav said.

230.title: Absolute treat: Finch picks Kohli, Babar as batters with best cover drive
230.article_body: During a Q&A session on KKR's Twitter handle, a fan asked Aaron Finch who he thinks plays the best cover drive. The Australia white-ball skipper replied, "Virat Kohli and Babar Azam- it's an absolute treat watching the two of these guys play that shot." Finch has joined the KKR camp in the ongoing IPL 2022 after completing international duties.

231.title: Heavy rainfall likely in Kerala, Tamil Nadu for next 2 days: IMD
231.article_body: The India Meteorological Department on Tuesday predicted that thunderstorms and heavy rainfall are likely to occur in Kerala and Tamil Nadu for the next two days. Taking to Twitter, the weather department said that fishermen are advised not to venture into rough seas. The IMD has also predicted some respite from the ongoing heatwave conditions over northwest India from Tuesday.

232.title: 'Doctor Strange 2' has got a darker tone to it: Benedict Cumberbatch
232.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch, speaking about 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', has said, "It's got a sort of darker tone to it...with Sam Raimi at the helm, you know he's a master of that." Benedict further said, "It's pretty unfathomably exciting where we're going in this film. It's the most fantastic new phase of Marvel."

233.title: Pregnant Rihanna poses on the cover of Vogue
233.article_body: Singer Rihanna, who is pregnant, posed for the cover of Vogue US' May edition. "Our lil fashion killa on da cover of VOGUE!!" she wrote while sharing the cover on Instagram. Rihanna, who shared the news of her pregnancy earlier this year, is expecting her first child with boyfriend A$AP Rocky.

234.title: FIR against Congress' Digvijay Singh over post on Khargone violence
234.article_body: An FIR has been registered against senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh over a tweet on the Khargone violence that broke out during a Ram Navami procession. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised Singh and termed his tweet a conspiracy to spread religious frenzy in the state. MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra had warned Singh of a legal action.

235.title: Russian soldiers kept Ukrainian women in basement for 25 days; 9 now said to be pregnant
235.article_body: Ukraine's official ombudsman for human rights, Lyudmyla Denisova, has said that Russian soldiers had kept a group of Ukrainian women and girls in a basement of a house for 25 days. Nine of them are now pregnant, she stated. Denisova claimed that Russian soldiers used sexual violence as a weapon of war against Ukrainian women.

236.title: I didn't abuse my paid leave, returned to work 2 days after father's death: Nooyi
236.article_body: PepsiCo's former CEO Indra Nooyi recently spoke about how she "didn't abuse" the six months of paid leave in her early career. "After my father was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer, BCG offered me six months of paid leave for his care," she said. "At the end of...three months...he died...and in three months, two days...I was back at work," she added.

237.title: Rehab is rocking: Federer shares pics training in the gym
237.article_body: Providing an update on his knee injury rehabilitation, 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer took to Instagram to post pictures of him training in the gym. "Rehab is rockinggggggg," he captioned the post. Federer hasn't played since Wimbledon 2021. The 40-year-old underwent a third right knee surgery in August last year. He's currently ranked 43rd in the world.

238.title: 20 dead after overnight rainfall in South African province
238.article_body: At least 20 people have died in South Africa's coastal province of KwaZulu-Natal due to floods triggered by overnight rainfall, officials said. Disaster management teams have been evacuating locals from mudslide and flood-prone areas, province's emergency spokesperson Robert Mckenzie said. Mckenzie further advised local residents to remain indoors amid reports of collapsed infrastructure.

239.title: Mass shooting & possible explosion in NYC subway station, many injured: Reports
239.article_body: Multiple people have been injured in a mass shooting and a possible explosion at a train station in New York's Brooklyn, reports said on Tuesday. Explosive devices have also reportedly been found at the site of the attack which occurred during the morning rush hour. Pictures shared online showed commuters at the scene with blood on their clothes.

240.title: SRK gave me a piece of advice before I became an actor: Abhishek
240.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan said Shah Rukh Khan gave him advice when he was set to become an actor. "SRK said there are two kinds of actors. Both run...there's one who runs because...mad dog is chasing him...other runs because he loves running," Abhishek said. He added, "SRK told...always be...second one. Do it because you love it...not because you're compelled by anything."

241.title: Trying to save culprits: WB Cong chief on CM's 'love affair' remark
241.article_body: Responding to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's 'love affair' remark on the Nadia rape case, the state's Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that she was trying to "save the culprits". "Despite being a woman, CM is giving statements that there was a love affair and other things. She is saying all this to divert public attention," he added.

242.title: Imran Khan calls for 'immediate' polls after being removed as Pak PM
242.article_body: Pakistan's ex-PM Imran Khan has called for "immediate" federal elections in the country after he was removed from office by the Opposition. "Let the people decide, through fair & free elections, whom they want as their prime minister," he tweeted. Khan said that he will hold a rally in Peshawar on Wednesday after "being removed through a foreign-instigated regime change".

243.title: Domestic patent filings surpass int'l filings in India for 1st time in 11 years
243.article_body: The number of domestic patent filing surpassed the number of international patent filing at Indian patent office for the first time in 11 years. Out of 19,796 patent applications filed during January-March 2022 quarter, 10,706 were filed by Indian applicants, the government said. Further, the number of patents filed in India increased 50% in seven years to 66,440 in 2021-22.

244.title: UK PM Boris Johnson, Finance Minister Rishi Sunak to be fined over lockdown parties
244.article_body: British PM Boris Johnson and Finance Minister Rishi Sunak are to receive fines for breaching strict coronavirus lockdown rules, a government statement said on Tuesday. Police have been investigating 12 gatherings at Downing Street and the Cabinet Office after an internal inquiry found Johnson's staff had enjoyed alcohol-fuelled parties. The PM had attended a few of the events himself.

245.title: Was the last thing I was planning on: Kim Kardashian on dating Pete
245.article_body: Television personality Kim Kardashian has said that dating Pete Davidson was the last thing she was planning on. "Sometimes things happen when you just least expect it," she stated. "It just makes it that much sweeter and so much more fun," Kim added. Kim had filed for divorce from rapper Kanye West in February 2021.

246.title: No question of resigning: KS Eshwarappa after contractor's death
246.article_body: Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa on Tuesday said that he won't be resigning after contractor Santhosh K Patil, in his suicide note, claimed that the minister was solely responsible for his death. "I had lodged a defamation case against the person who accused me of (corruption). He should've fought it in the court, I'm nowhere related to his suicide," Eshwarappa said.

247.title: RCB to bowl first as winless CSK lose toss for the 4th time, playing XIs announced
247.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK. CSK, who lost their first four IPL 2022 matches, lost the toss for the fourth time. RCB have made two changes to their playing XI, with Suyash Prabhudessai and Josh Hazlewood replacing Harshal Patel and David Willey, respectively. CSK are fielding an unchanged side.

248.title: Growing Muslim population isn't threat but radical thinking: Giriraj
248.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh has said that the "increasing population of Muslims isn't a threat, but radical thinking is a threat to India". He added the repeated incidents of stone-pelting on Ram Navami or any procession aren't a "coincidence, but an experiment". His remarks came amid communal violence incidents that broke out in India's several parts during Ram Navami processions.

249.title: Sidhu Moose Wala releases song on his Punjab poll defeat; AAP criticises him
249.article_body: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moose Wala has released a song titled 'Scapegoat', which is based on his defeat as Congress candidate in the recent state Assembly elections. AAP leader Malwinder Singh Kang accused Moose Wala of referring to people of Punjab as 'gaddar' (traitors) in his song. "Punjabis are neither traitors nor hypocrites," AAP MLA Jeevan Jyot Kaur tweeted.

250.title: Have learned lot from Dhoni, he's fantastic captain: RCB skipper Du Plessis
250.article_body: Ahead of RCB-CSK in IPL 2022, RCB captain Faf du Plessis said his ex-team CSK has a special place in his heart. "I'm extremely grateful for Chennai and being around them for more than 10 years...I've learned a lot from MS Dhoni, he's a fantastic captain as well," he added. "It would be...great to play against Chennai," he further said.

251.title: Raj govt sanctions water train for Pali, will cost ₹15 lakh/day
251.article_body: Rajasthan government has sanctioned a water train to supply drinking water to the parched city of Pali from April 15. The water train will reportedly cost ₹15 lakh/day. Apart from this, the government is also supplying water to 208 towns, out of which 18 are getting water once every 96 hours and 15 are getting water once every 72 hours.

252.title: Ram didn't walk away with all the accolades for 'RRR': Rajamouli
252.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli has reacted to the claims that Ram Charan was given more screen time than Jr NTR in 'RRR'. "That wasn't the right way of putting it, that Ram walked away with all the accolades," Rajamouli stated. He added, "If you look...from a certain perspective, it might seem like one actor has been given more screen space."

253.title: Blind US man drives car at 339kmh to break Guinness Record on accident's 10th anniversary
253.article_body: US race car driver Dan Parker, who was blinded in an accident, drove a customised car at a speed of 339.64 kmh to achieve the Guinness World Records title for "Fastest Speed for a Car Driven Blindfolded" on March 31. Parker achieved the feat by breaking the previous record of 322.68 kmh on the 10th anniversary of his accident.

254.title: He said 'Take your clothes off or I'll shoot': Ukrainian woman raped by Russian soldier
254.article_body: A 50-year-old Ukrainian woman was at home when a soldier barged in and dragged her to a house nearby, she said. "He was ordering me 'Take your clothes off or I'll shoot you'. While he was raping me, four more soldiers entered...They took him away," she stated. She further said her husband was shot and he died two days later.

255.title: Saudi govt-owned channel mocks US President & VP Harris in comedy sketch
255.article_body: A major Saudi government-owned broadcaster has aired a sketch mocking US President Joe Biden and Vice-President Kamala Harris. The sketch aired on MBC's show 'Studio 22', showed Biden's character as sleepy and forgetful, even as the actor portraying Harris stopped him from wandering off. The actor playing Biden is also heard calling Harris his "first lady".

256.title: Did others go there to drink lassi: Harbhajan on Dhoni getting credit for World Cup win
256.article_body: Talking about cricket being a team game, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said that when India won the 2011 World Cup, headlines said, "MS Dhoni won India the World Cup." Harbhajan stated, "Did others go there to drink lassi? What did Gautam Gambhir do, what did others do?" He added that a team progresses only when multiple players contribute.

257.title: Husband-wife's OfBusiness seeks $2 bn in India's biggest tech IPO since Paytm
257.article_body: Husband-wife Asish Mohapatra and Ruchi Kalra's unicorn startup OfBusiness, a supplier of raw materials to small businesses, is in discussions with banks about raising $2 billion in an IPO, Bloomberg reported. At $2 billion, Gurugram-headquartered OfBusiness' IPO could be India's largest tech IPO after Paytm's. While Asish is the CEO of OfBusiness, Kalra has her own unicorn startup Oxyzo.

258.title: Thinking about Kohli's gesture after my 1st IPL ton still gives me goosebumps: Padikkal
258.article_body: RR batter Devdutt Padikkal said thinking about Virat Kohli's gesture after his first IPL hundred still gives him goosebumps. Padikkal, who represented RCB in IPL 2020 and 2021, revealed after he scored the hundred against RR in 2021, the then RCB captain asked the cameraman to focus on Padikkal instead of him as Padikkal was the "main man" that day.

259.title: PM to receive 1st award named in memory of Lata Mangeshkar on Apr 24
259.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will receive first Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award for selfless service to nation on April 24. The award has been instituted in memory of veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar, who died at the age of 92 in February. "This award will be given every year to only one individual who has made path-breaking...contributions to our nation," a statement said.

260.title: Hospitals face shortage of medicines, cancel surgeries in Sri Lanka
260.article_body: Hospitals in Sri Lanka are facing a shortage of medicines amid a severe economic crisis in the country. This has led to some surgeries being cancelled, according to Reuters. Out of 1,325 drugs that the government provides to state-run hospitals, three life-saving medicines have completely run out and another 140 essential ones are in short supply, an official said.

261.title: J'khand HC takes suo motu cognisance of cable-car mishap, orders probe
261.article_body: Jharkhand High Court has taken suo motu cognisance of the cable car collision incident in Deoghar and ordered an inquiry into the matter. It'll hear the matter on April 26 and the state has to file a detailed inquiry report through an affidavit. Notably, three persons died in the incident and others were rescued as the rescue operation ended today.

262.title: Mann is a rubber stamp, Kejriwal has taken over Punjab: Amarinder Singh
262.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Tuesday called current Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann a "rubber stamp" and alleged that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has taken over Punjab. His remark came following Kejriwal's meeting with the officials of the Punjab State Power Corporation Limited (PSPCL) in the absence of CM Bhagwant Mann.

263.title: UP tea stall owners rename shop as 'Bulldozer Baba' as tribute to CM
263.article_body: The owners of a tea stall in UP's Varanasi have renamed their shop as 'Bulldozer Baba Tea Stall' as a "mark of respect" to CM Yogi Adityanath. "Our tea is as 'kadak' as the bulldozer," owner Ram Surat said. The moniker has come to be associated with CM Yogi following his use of bulldozers to crackdown on properties of criminals.

264.title: 1st made-in-India Dornier 228 plane takes off for maiden commercial flight
264.article_body: The first-ever made-in-India civil Dornier 228 aircraft with 17 seats took off on Tuesday for its first commercial flight from Dibrugarh (Assam) to Pasighat (Arunachal Pradesh). The flight is operated by Alliance Air, making it India's first commercial airline to fly India-made aircraft for civil operations. Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia and Kiren Rijiju were onboard the flight.

265.title: Ravindra Jadeja's bat has been absolutely silent in IPL 2022: Aakash
265.article_body: Discussing Ravindra Jadeja's form in IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra said the CSK captain's bat has been "absolutely silent". He added, "If he doesn't score runs, the team will not go a long way. With the ball, Jaddu (Jadeja) has done well against Glenn Maxwell." Jadeja has scored 26*, 17, 0, 23 in the tournament so far.

266.title: TMC's Supriyo alleges electoral malpractice by BJP in WB bypolls
266.article_body: Accusing the BJP of engaging in electoral malpractices, TMC's Ballygunge Assembly by-poll candidate, Babul Supriyo, on Tuesday claimed that "BJP candidate Keya Ghosh entered a couple of booths last night". He added, "TMC has lodged an official complaint with the Election Commission. We got a reaction from them." He also claimed that EVMs weren't working properly in over 20 places.

267.title: Will create 1.3 million jobs in 5 yrs: Australian PM ahead of polls
267.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison has pledged to create 1.3 million new jobs over five years in his latest poll pitch, ahead of country's federal elections in May. "Boosting job creation to...levels we saw...before...pandemic is key to our plan for...stronger economy," he said. Morrison added that his government has reduced Australia's unemployment rate despite global recession and other challenges.

268.title: 60 kg lemons, 40 kg onions stolen from UP warehouse amid price rise
268.article_body: Around 60 kg of lemons along with 40 kg of onions and 38 kg of garlic were stolen from a warehouse in UP's Shahjahanpur. The trader told police he found the godown's lock broken with vegetables lying scattered on road in the morning on Monday. Police believe the rising prices of lemons could be a possible reason for the theft.

269.title: Retail inflation rises to 17-month-high of 6.95% in March 2022
269.article_body: India's retail inflation jumped to a 17-month high of 6.95% in March 2022 due to higher food and oil prices, data released by the government on Tuesday showed. This is the third consecutive month in which retail inflation has breached the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) upper margin of 6%. The country's retail inflation stood at 6.01% for February 2022.

270.title: Father said 'Now nothing can be changed' Axar on 'Akshar' becoming 'Axar' on documents
270.article_body: Talking about his name becoming 'Axar' from 'Akshar' after his school principal mistakenly wrote 'Axar' in his relieving certificate, the Delhi Capitals all-rounder said, "NCA asked me about my name being 'Axar' on passport...after which I called my father." "My father said, 'Now....nothing can be changed'," he added. "Everything was going well...so I thought let's not change 'Axar'," he stated.

271.title: New Pak PM reduces weekly offs, changes office timing from 10 am to 8 am on 1st day
271.article_body: Pakistan's new PM Shehbaz Sharif, on the first day in office, reduced two weekly offs to one in government offices and changed their timings to 8 am instead of 10 am. He announced that only Sunday will be the weekly off day. "We have come to serve the masses and no moment will be wasted," he said.

272.title: Record for highest price rise in India goes to Cong: K'taka CM
272.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the credit and record for highest price rise in India go to Congress. "Congress has no moral right to protest against price rise," Bommai added. "The rising prices have made life difficult for the common man," Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar had said earlier.

273.title: Bringing deprived classes to mainstream is BJP's objective: K'taka CM
273.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday evening said that BJP's objective is to bring the deprived and voiceless classes to the mainstream. "Over the years, many programmes have been drawn to bring equality in India, but have not been implemented effectively. Our government has formulated action plans to deliver our promises," he further said.

274.title: B'luru Police conduct drive against unauthorised number plates
274.article_body: The Bengaluru City Police on Tuesday carried out a special drive against unauthorised vehicle number plates, police informed on Twitter. During the drive, the police issued fines against people over the same and removed the unauthorised number plates from their vehicles, according to the information shared on Twitter. Police have shared pictures of the drive on their official Twitter handle.

275.title: Can you help me understand numbers better?: Ashneer on BharatPe's 'best month'
275.article_body: Ashneer Grover responded after BharatPe's CPO Ankur Jain said "March 2022 was the best month" in BharatPe's journey. "The last few months...were tumultuous. However, everyone...rallied around and executed brilliantly," Jain said. Sharing a report on BharatPe's performance under him, Ashneer replied, "Sir, numbers are much better expressed quantitatively. Could you help me understand them better?"

276.title: Jailed Egyptian pro-democracy activist receives UK citizenship
276.article_body: Jailed activist Alaa Abdel-Fattah, who gained prominence during Egypt's 2011 uprising, has received British citizenship, his family confirmed on Monday. Fattah, who was arrested in 2019, is currently serving a five-year prison term after being charged with spreading fake news. Fattah's family said in a statement that he has been kept in a jail cell that receives no sunlight.

277.title: Childhood pic of Aishwarya surfaces online, fans draw resemblance to Aaradhya
277.article_body: A childhood picture of actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan from an old ad has surfaced online. Several Instagram users drew a resemblance to her daughter Aaradhya Bachchan after an Instagram account posted Aishwarya's photograph from the ad. "Wow, Aaradhya looks just like Aishwarya," a user commented on the post. "Aaradhya resembles her mother," another user reacted.

278.title: Man robbed of ₹8 lakh by 4 people in Noida's Sector 88
278.article_body: Over ₹8 lakh were stolen from a man by four unidentified assailants at a vegetable market in Noida Sector 88, an official said on Tuesday. The complainant works for a businessman who supplies vegetables to vendors in the market and he would collect money from vendors on his boss' behalf. The police have formed four teams to nab the assailants.

279.title: Country setting new benchmarks in field of health: PM Modi
279.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday hailed people's resolve in the fight against COVID-19 and said that India is setting new benchmarks in the field of health. "Whether it is the world's largest free vaccination campaign with indigenous vaccines or the development of medical infrastructure, the country is setting new benchmarks in the field of health," he said.

280.title: PML(N) leaders say Nawaz Sharif not returning to Pak soon: Report
280.article_body: Senior PML(N) leaders have ruled out possibility of Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's brother and ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's immediate return to country, Dawn reported. "Sharif family thinks...[Nawaz's] early return will establish...Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf's propaganda that he doesn't have serious health issues," a party leader said. Nawaz Sharif has been residing in London since 2019 for medical treatment.

281.title: Hyd Police's discount offer on pending traffic challans to end on Friday
281.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday informed the time for clearing pending traffic challans on a discount offer will end on April 15 (Friday). Requesting the public to utilise the opportunity, police said the offer will not be extended. Under the scheme, two-wheelers are given a 75% discount on pending challans, whereas a 50% discount is being given to car owners.

282.title: Oil breaches $100 mark again as China eases COVID-19 curbs
282.article_body: Oil price breached the $100 mark again on Tuesday after relaxation of COVID-19 curbs in Shanghai eased concerns about Chinese demand. Brent crude rose by $3.26 to $101.74/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) rose $3.01 to $97.3/barrel. Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries' warning that it would be impossible to replace potential supply losses from Russia also affected prices.

283.title: Bomb hurled near Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' site in Nalanda
283.article_body: A bomb was hurled near Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' (public meeting) in Nalanda district on Tuesday. One person has been detained in connection with the incident. This comes days after Kumar was attacked by a man, who is believed to be mentally unstable, during an event at his hometown Bakhtiyarpur in Patna.

284.title: Superb: Shiv Sena MP on Jaishankar's remarks on India's Russian oil imports
284.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi on Tuesday praised Foreign Minister S Jaishankar's remarks in the US on India's oil purchase from Russia. Jaishankar while replying to a question said India's total monthly purchase of oil from Russia is probably less than what Europe does in an afternoon. "Superb from EAM!," Chaturvedi tweeted with clapping emojis.

285.title: Renowned Indian-American surgeon demoted over 'ghost surgeries' in US
285.article_body: Renowned Indian American surgeon Dr Anil Nanda has been removed as the head of the Department of Neurosurgery at Rutgers medical school in US' New Jersey, amid allegations of performing 'ghost surgeries', the university announced. Ghost surgeries refer to surgeons conducting surgeries on another surgeon's patient with mutual agreement but without informing the patient, who is under anaesthesia.

286.title: 70-yr-old newly elected Pak PM married 5 times, currently has 2 wives
286.article_body: The newly-elected 70-year-old Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has married five times and presently has two wives, Nusrat and Tehmina Durani, while he divorced the three others, namely- Alia Hani, Nilofar Khosa and Kulsoom Hai. He has two sons and three daughters from Nusrat and one daughter from Alia. Shehbaz is the younger brother of three-time former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif.

287.title: De Villiers batted that way in his prime: Shastri on Suryakumar's 37-ball 68*
287.article_body: Reacting to MI batter Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 68 off 37 balls against RCB, Ravi Shastri said Suryakumar's gameplay is very unreal, comparing his knock to performances by AB de Villiers in his prime. "Unbelievable. He played a gem," added Shastri. "When you have your team on the mat, to throw a counter-punch like he did, it was amazing," stated Shastri.

288.title: 19,600 Russian soldiers killed, 732 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
288.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Ministry on Tuesday claimed that about 19,600 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. The ministry said its military has destroyed 732 Russian tanks and nearly 300 aircraft, including 140 helicopters. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 1,946 armoured personnel carriers, 349 artillery systems and 111 multiple launch rocket systems.

289.title: 35-year-old Kiwi pacer Hamish Bennett retires from all forms of cricket
289.article_body: New Zealand pacer Hamish Bennett (35) announced retirement from all forms of cricket on Tuesday. Bennett said that the ongoing 2021/22 season will be the last of his 17-year-long professional career. "When I started out as a young kid bowling...in Timaru, I never dreamed I would have gone on to enjoy the career that I've had," Bennett said.

290.title: Robbers loot gold, cash from 2 express trains on same night in UP
290.article_body: Armed robbers attacked two express trains and looted gold ornaments, cash, mobile phones and other valuables around Sunday midnight in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad. Seven passengers on the trains, Amritsar Express and Faizabad Express, were injured in the incident. As per a railway official, there is no total estimate of the looted items yet.

291.title: Anupam reveals Sooraj Barjatya worked as clapper boy in his 1984 film Saaransh
291.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a video from the sets of his upcoming film 'Uunchai', which is being directed by Sooraj Barjatya. In the video, Anupam can be seen holding a clapper board and giving a clap during the shoot. "During...'Saaransh', Sooraj was...assistant and...clapper boy...So it was fun to do...same job while he's directing...magnum opus #Uunchai," Anupam wrote.

292.title: Russia will achieve noble aims of Ukraine military campaign: Putin
292.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday said that Moscow's military operation in Ukraine would undoubtedly achieve its "noble" objectives. Putin added that Moscow "did not have a choice" but to launch a military operation to protect itself and save people in the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine, where Russian-backed separatists have been fighting Ukrainian forces since 2014.

293.title: MP govt cannot bulldoze country's law, Constitution: Brinda Karat
293.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat on Tuesday condemned the Madhya Pradesh government saying it cannot bulldoze the 'law and Constitution of the country'. Her comments came after the government demolished houses of those who pelted stones at a Ram Navami procession in Khargone on Sunday. "If the houses are illegal, then serve notice to them," she added.

294.title: Army Chief to visit Bombay Engineer Group and Centre in Pune today
294.article_body: Chief of Army Staff (COAS) General Manoj Mukund Naravane is scheduled to visit the Bombay Engineer Group and Centre in Pune on Tuesday. According to the officials, the army chief will formally induct indigenously developed High Mobility Vehicles (HMVs) and Long Range Observation System into the Indian Army. Notably, the COAS will preside over the induction ceremony as well.

295.title: Iran asks Taliban to ensure safety of its diplomats in Afghanistan
295.article_body: Iran has asked the Taliban to ensure the safety of its diplomats and embassies in Afghanistan. This comes amid protests by locals following reports of ill-treatment of Afghan refugees in Iran. Earlier, Iran's embassy in Kabul had called such reports a foreign conspiracy aimed at disturbing the bilateral relations between the two countries.

296.title: Marathi actors are paid less in Hindi TV industry: Actor Prasad Oak
296.article_body: Actor-director Prasad Oak said in an interview that he is "happy with...Marathi industry" and has no desire to work in the Hindi television industry. "On Hindi television, Marathi performers get paid less," he added. "I thought, why so much disparity...Comparatively, I was getting more money from Marathi shows than Hindi shows. Why should I keep myself economically low?" Prasad said.

297.title: Babar is the Brian Lara, Don Bradman of this era: Ex-Pak captain Latif
297.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said Pakistan captain Babar Azam is the Don Bradman and Brian Lara of this era. Talking about comparisons between Virat Kohli and Sachin Tendulkar, Latif stated, "For doing that, you have to analyse a lot of things. Umpiring, DRS..., pitches, bats, balls used, ground dimensions. The game has changed a lot."

298.title: Bengal police acting as TMC polling agents: BJP's Malviya on bypolls
298.article_body: Amid ongoing Lok Sabha and Assembly bypolls in West Bengal, BJP's Amit Malviya alleged on Tuesday that the state police were acting as "polling agents" for Trinamool Congress (TMC). He further alleged that the media was denied access to cover the polling. Malviya's comments came after BJP's Agnimitra Paul alleged that TMC workers hurled stones at her convoy in Asansol.

299.title: I had perinatal depression, it's horrible: Britney while announcing 3rd pregnancy
299.article_body: American pop singer Britney Spears, while announcing that she's pregnant with her third child, opened up about facing perinatal depression during a previous pregnancy. "It's absolutely horrible...women didn't talk about it back then...some people considered it dangerous if a woman complained like that with a baby inside her...but now women talk about it every day," said 40-year-old Spears.

300.title: Orange wristbands issued to team by Ranbir-Alia's wedding planners for security: Report
300.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's reported wedding planners have issued special orange-coloured wristbands to all their team members, as per a report. This is to avoid breaches and to ensure there is no leak of photos and videos, the report added. The bands reportedly have tags encoded on them to give the team members access to key points.

301.title: Leave IPL for a week and join protests: Ranatunga to SL cricketers amid economic crisis
301.article_body: Former Sri Lanka captain Arjuna Ranatunga has urged Sri Lankan cricketers playing in IPL to leave the tournament for a week and join protests in the country amid economic crisis. "There are some cricketers who are lavishly playing in IPL and haven't spoken about their country. Unfortunately, people are scared to speak against the government," he said.

302.title: He said 'Bapu, tu aaya aur mujhe le gaya': Axar Patel on Dhoni's retirement from Tests
302.article_body: Recalling MS Dhoni announcing his retirement from Tests during India's tour of Australia in 2014, Axar Patel, who had received his maiden Test call-up at the time, said, "Dhoni jokingly told me, 'Bapu...tu aaya aur mujhe le gaya'." Axar added he got teary-eyed after Dhoni announced his decision to retire. Axar also revealed Suresh Raina broke down following the announcement.

303.title: SC stays Congress leader Hardik Patel's conviction in 2015 riot case
303.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday stayed the conviction of Congress leader Hardik Patel in a 2015 riot case amid the Patidar agitation in Gujarat. "We are of the view that this is the fit case for the high court to have stayed the conviction. The conviction is, hereby, stayed until the appeals are decided accordingly," SC said.

304.title: They always turn things around: Hogg on CSK's worst start to IPL season
304.article_body: Ex-KKR spinner Brad Hogg said CSK cannot be written off in IPL 2022 despite recording their worst start in an IPL season, as they always turn things around. "CSK...[will] have to re-establish themselves, reset and look at different options in the bowling and batting department," added Hogg. CSK have lost all four IPL 2022 matches played so far.

305.title: Over 8 lakh pilgrims expected at this year's Amarnath Yatra: Officials
305.article_body: Amarnath Yatra this year "will be historic" and "twice in size" than before, with the Jammu and Kashmir administration preparing to welcome about 8 lakh pilgrims to the cave shrine in south Kashmir Himalayas, officials said. All arrangements will be done for security, an official added. Amarnath Yatra was not conducted in 2020 and 2021 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

306.title: Police constable caught taking ₹1.5 lakh bribe in Gurugram
306.article_body: A police constable was caught taking ₹1.5 lakh as a bribe in Gurugram, an official said on Monday. The constable had demanded the bribe to help two men held in a fraud case, the official added. The arrest was made after a relative of one of the accused had filed a complaint against the constable at the Rohtak Vigilance Department.

307.title: Former Jammu & Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti placed under house arrest
307.article_body: Authorities placed former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti under house arrest in Srinagar on Tuesday to prevent her from going to Anantnag district. Mufti claimed that she intended to visit the family of a Kashmiri Pandit who was attacked in Shopian. "Government of India wilfully spreads fake propaganda about Kashmiri mainstream and muslims responsible for pandit exodus," she added.

308.title: Indian Oil removes Russian Urals from its latest tender: Report
308.article_body: Indian Oil Corp (IOC) excluded several high-sulfur crude grades, including Russian Urals, from its latest tender closing on Tuesday, Reuters reported. It reportedly informed market participants that Das, Eugene Island, Thunder Horse and Urals crude were no longer on the list of grades under its latest tender. IOC imports crude for itself and on behalf of its Chennai Petroleum subsidiary.

309.title: Karthik is the most dangerous player for cameos in T20s: Manjrekar
309.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said he has always believed that RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik is the most dangerous player for cameos in T20 cricket. Talking about former RCB captain Virat Kohli, Manjrekar stated that Kohli's power game has diminished. "Once his power game gets better, then I will say Kohli has arrived in T20 cricket," said Manjrekar.

310.title: B'desh pacer Khaled Ahmed fined 15% of match fee for throwing ball at SA batter
310.article_body: Bangladesh pacer Khaled Ahmed has been fined 15 per cent of his match fee after he threw the ball towards South Africa batter Kyle Verreynne, hitting him on the right glove during their second Test. Khaled was found guilty of breaching the ICC Code of Conduct and one demerit point was also added to his disciplinary record.

311.title: Govt should run bulldozer on problems of people: Rahul Gandhi
311.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that the government should "run a bulldozer" on issues like inflation and unemployment. "Inflation and unemployment have exhausted the people of the country," Gandhi tweeted. "The government should run a bulldozer on these problems but there’s hatred and panic on BJP’s bulldozer," he added.

312.title: Former Japanese princess working as unpaid volunteer at US museum: Reports
312.article_body: Japan's former Princess Mako is now an unpaid volunteer at New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art after giving up her titles to marry a commoner, according to reports. Mako moved to the US in November 2021, one month after marrying Kei Komuro, her college boyfriend who works at a law firm in the city.

313.title: CSK have a lot of question marks: Parthiv ahead of CSK vs RCB
313.article_body: Talking about defending champions CSK, who are winless in IPL 2022 so far, Parthiv Patel said there are a lot of question marks whether it's about their bowling combination or batting. "They've Robin Uthappa...Ambati Rayudu, but Ruturaj Gaikwad's form has drastically changed...they've made a big change with Ravindra Jadeja as captain," he added. CSK will face RCB today.

314.title: Taiwan iPhone maker Pegatron suspends ops at China plants amid COVID-19
314.article_body: Taiwan's Pegatron, which assembles iPhones, has suspended operations at its Shanghai and Kunshan plants amid the government's measures against COVID-19. The resumption of work depends on the two plants being given clearance by the government. It will also maintain close contact with customers and suppliers and would "actively cooperate" with local governments to resume work as soon as possible.

315.title: 2 arrested with ganja worth over ₹1.8 lakh in Thane
315.article_body: Police have arrested two people for their alleged connection with the sale of ganja in Maharashtra's Thane. Ganja worth ₹1.8 lakh was also seized from their possession, police said on Tuesday. Police are also looking for the third accused who allegedly cultivated ganja in Shirpur of Maharashtra's Dhule district, an official said.

316.title: Rachakonda Police bust fake land documents racket, 9 gang members held
316.article_body: The Rachakonda Police on Monday busted a fake land documents racket and apprehended nine people. According to police, the gang members used to target vacant lands not claimed by original land owners for a long time. Police also recovered 10 fake sale deed documents, forged government stamps, fake ID cards, 10 cell phones and over ₹10 lakh cash from them.

317.title: Andhra CM announces ₹2 lakh ex gratia for families of train accident victims
317.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has announced ₹2 lakh ex gratia for the families of each of the five passengers who were killed when Konark Express ran over them in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam. According to the district collector, two of the deceased were identified as residents of Assam while the remaining ones are yet to be identified.

318.title: Over 50% of global population suffers from headaches: Study
318.article_body: According to research, 52% of the global population is affected by headache disorder every year with 14% of them reporting migraine. As per research, headaches, especially migraines were more common in females (17%) than males (8.6%). Headaches that last for 15 or more days per month were seen in 6% of females as compared to 2.9% of males.

319.title: My parents considered me playing cricket like a crime: RCB's Akash Deep
319.article_body: RCB pacer Akash Deep said his parents used to consider him playing cricket as equal to a crime, adding that his father was sceptical about his future. "There was a reason for that as whoever from that region played cricket didn't make it big in life," added Akash. "I used to sneak out and play cricket," stated Akash.

320.title: Kohli got out on low pitches while Sachin would never be dismissed: Latif
320.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said Sachin Tendulkar would never get dismissed on low pitches, whereas Virat Kohli got out when batting on such pitches during India's recent Test series against Sri Lanka. "That is the fault in [Kohli's batting]," added Latif. "On poor pitches, there is no batsman better than Sachin," stated Latif.

321.title: Nadal skips Barcelona Open, comeback date remains uncertain
321.article_body: 21-times Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal has decided to skip this month's Barcelona Open as he is yet to recover from a rib injury. "Rafa has just been withdrawn from the entry list in Barcelona," the Spaniard's team said in a statement. "We don't know yet when he will be at his first tournament on clay this year," they added.

322.title: China approves 1st batch of new video game licenses in 9 months
322.article_body: China approved new video game licenses on Monday for the first time in nine months. The country had last approved games in July 2021, in which 87 games had received licenses. This time 45 new titles were granted licenses. Of the 45 titles, not a single one is from the big domestic leaders NetEase and Tencent Holdings, media reports said.

323.title: UN recognises Hyd as '2021 Tree City of the World' for 2nd straight year
323.article_body: For a second consecutive year, Hyderabad has been jointly recognised as the '2021 Tree City of the World' by the United Nations' Food and Agriculture Organisation and Arbor Day Foundation. According to the organisation, 3,50,56,635 trees were planted in the city with 500 volunteer hours. Reacting to the same, Telangana special chief secretary Arvind Kumar tweeted, "Matter of immense pride."

324.title: Indonesia parliament passes landmark Bill against sexual violence
324.article_body: Indonesia's parliament has passed a landmark Bill aimed at tackling sexual violence cases. According to the final draft of the Bill, crimes of physical sexual abuse will attract 12 years imprisonment, while there will be 15 years jail term for sexual exploitation. It also includes nine years jail for forced marriage and four years for circulating non-consensual sexual content.

325.title: India ready to supply food stock to world if WTO allows: PM Modi
325.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that during a virtual meeting with US President Joe Biden on Monday, he suggested to supply food stock to the world if the World Trade Organisation allows it. While addressing an event in Gujarat online, PM Modi added that food stock in different parts of the world is dwindling due to the Russia-Ukraine war.

326.title: Ayushmann's 'Anek' release postponed, film to now release on May 27
326.article_body: The release of 'Anek', starring Ayushmann Khurrana, has been postponed. The action thriller film, which was initially set to release on May 13, will now hit the screens on May 27. The makers shared a poster of the film on Tuesday, revealing the new release date of the film. 'Anek' has been directed by Anubhav Sinha.

327.title: Magic mushrooms could be an alternative to depression treatments: Study
327.article_body: The psychedelic compound found in magic mushrooms could be an alternative to depression treatments, a study stated. "Psilocybin works differently from conventional antidepressants - making the brain more flexible and fluid, and less entrenched in the negative thinking patterns associated with depression," a researcher said. It helps to open up people's brains that can become rigid in depression.

328.title: Sanjay Raut, Eknath Khadse's phones tapped by BJP in 2019: Maha Home Minister
328.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil claimed that Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's phone was tapped for 60 days and NCP's Eknath Khadse's phone was tapped for 67 days in 2019 before formation of MVA government. He alleged that BJP was behind the phone tapping incidents in which IPS Rashmi Shukla was accused of illegally tapping phones of Maharashtra leaders.

329.title: Aamir, Shah Rukh, Bhansali to attend Ranbir-Alia's wedding: Report
329.article_body: Actors Aamir Khan and Shah Rukh Khan and filmmakers Sanjay Leela Bhansali, Karan Johar and Ayan Mukerji are among the people who have been invited to Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, according to Pinkvilla. The report stated that they will attend the varmala ceremony of Alia and Ranbir, who will reportedly tie the knot at RK Studios in Mumbai.

330.title: Petition filed against WB CM's 'love affair' remark on Nadia rape case
330.article_body: A petition was filed against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee in the Calcutta High Court for her 'love-affair' remark on the rape of a 14-year-old girl in the state's Nadia district. Banerjee's comment on the rape of the minor girl "is not just abhorrent but also steeped in gross illegality," said BJP's central observer for West Bengal Amit Malviya.

331.title: SC allows colour blind people to pursue all filmmaking courses
331.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday directed the Pune-based Film and Television Institute of India to allow people suffering from colour blindness to pursue all filmmaking courses. "It's much easier to change laws, but it takes a long time to change the mindset," it said. An experts' committee, formed by the apex court on the issue, had also recommended the same.

332.title: Actor Prabhas has the most expensive eyes: 'Adipurush' director
332.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut has said that actor Prabhas has the most expensive eyes and added that it is a "reflection of his heart". "I have managed to get Prabhas to convey the emotions that I have wanted him to, through his eyes," he added. Speaking about Prabhas, Om called the actor the "biggest star in India".

333.title: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath calls on Amit Shah in Delhi
333.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath called on Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday during his visit to the national capital. "Held a discussion with UP CM Yogi Adityanath and Deputy CMs Keshav Prasad Maurya and Brajesh Pathak over the development and governance initiative being undertaken in the state," Shah tweeted.

334.title: Union education ministry seeks report on JNU violence
334.article_body: The Union Ministry of Education has sought a report from the JNU administration on the violence that occurred on the occasion of Ram Navami inside the university's campus on Sunday. "Whenever an incident of unrest is reported from any central university, the ministry asks for a report," said a ministry official. Notably, 16 students had got injured in the incident.

335.title: India, US to restart commercial dialogue, CEO forum: Blinken
335.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken announced that India and the US are restarting their bilateral commercial dialogue and the CEO's forum later this year. Blinken added that the two countries already trade to the tune of over $150 billion each year. "It can allow us to increase our collaboration across more issues including digital trade...and tax policy," he added.

336.title: Meta spent $26.8 million on CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021
336.article_body: Meta spent $26.8 million on its CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021, regulatory filings revealed. Meta said, "He is synonymous with Meta and, as a result, negative sentiment regarding our company is directly associated with, and often transferred to, Zuckerberg." The 37-year-old billionaire took home a base salary of $1 last year and doesn't receive a bonus or equity awards.

337.title: Italy signs gas deal with Algeria to reduce reliance on Russia
337.article_body: Italy's PM Mario Draghi has announced a major gas deal with Algeria, which promises to reduce the country's reliance on Russian imports. Italy buys the vast majority of its natural gas from overseas, with 40% of its supplies coming from Russia. Europe is trying to cut its reliance on Russian natural gas imports in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

338.title: Zilingo suspends Indian-origin CEO amid financial probe: Report
338.article_body: Singapore's fashion startup Zilingo's Indian-origin CEO Ankiti Bose has been suspended amid an investigation by investors into the startup's financial practices, Bloomberg reported. The concerns are based on the way that Zilingo accounted for transactions and revenue across a platform spanning thousands of small merchants. Bose contends her suspension was due in part to her harassment complaints.

339.title: Delhi govt to plant 35.38 lakh saplings from July onwards
339.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Tuesday said the Delhi government will plant 35.38 lakh saplings during the annual plantation drive. He also launched a helpline number (1800118600) for organisations and individuals willing to be a part of the drive. The concerned departments have been directed to complete preparations by June-end and begin the drive in July, Rai added.

340.title: ₹38 cr property damaged as fire continues to burn at T'gana godown
340.article_body: A massive fire that broke out at a Telangana State Handloom Weavers Co-operative Society (TSCO) godown in Warangal on Monday night is still burning today as six fire tenders are attempting to put it out. No casualties have been reported till now. TSCO officials have said that an estimated ₹38 crore of the property has been lost so far.

341.title: List of 10 busiest airports in the world released
341.article_body: Airports Council International World has released the list of 10 busiest airports for 2021, stating that global passengers in 2021 were around 4.5 billion. US' Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport is the world's busiest airport, followed by US' Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport and  Denver International Airport. Eight of the world's 10 busiest airports are in US and two in China.

342.title: Group of Gurugram residents complain of irregular water supply
342.article_body: Residents of Gurugram's Sushant Lok, South City 2, Sector 56 and adjoining areas have complained of inadequate and irregular water supply for nearly two weeks. Most of the residents are paying between ₹1,700 and ₹2,000 for a tanker almost daily, according to a report. The residents claimed that the local authorities have not yet acted on their complaints.

343.title: Contractor who accused BJP minister Eshwarappa of corruption dies by suicide
343.article_body: Contractor Santhosh Patil, who had accused Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa of corruption, died by suicide in a lodge in Udupi on Tuesday, police said. CM Basavaraj S Bommai said the contractor's death will be thoroughly investigated and that the state government wouldn't interfere in the matter. Earlier, Patil had claimed that Eshwarappa charged him 40% commission for a work order.

344.title: Delhi's daily COVID positivity rate rises to 2.70%, highest in 2 months
344.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 137 new coronavirus cases, according to official data. With the rise in cases, Delhi's daily COVID-19 positivity rate has increased to 2.70%, the highest in the last two months. COVID-19 active cases in the city now stand at 601. Meanwhile, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said the government is keeping a close watch on the COVID-19 situation.

345.title: Twitter user raises over ₹1 lakh to buy bike for Zomato delivery agent in Rajasthan
345.article_body: A Twitter user, Aditya Sharma, has narrated how he raised over ₹1 lakh in less than 24 hours to purchase a bike for a Zomato delivery agent in Rajasthan. Sharma had tweeted a photo of Durga Meena completing his deliveries on a bicycle in hot weather and mentioned that Durga is a former teacher who lost his job in lockdown.

346.title: Wake-up call for industry to get its act together: Hero Electric MD on EV fires
346.article_body: Hero Electric MD Naveen Munjal told Moneycontrol the recent incidents of e-scooters catching fire are a wake-up call for the industry to get its act together. He said that issues with electric vehicles (EVs) have to be addressed by proper testing and due diligence. "You can't shortcut a lot of these things, which could lead to dangerous territory," he added.

347.title: Video shows woman falling to death during rescue mission on Jharkhand ropeway
347.article_body: The death toll in the Jharkhand cable car accident rose to three on Tuesday after a woman fell to death while being rescued. Video from the site showed the woman losing balance and falling to the ground. On Monday, a man also lost his life while he was being rescued by an Air Force helicopter.

348.title: Ready to reserve 33% seats for women in civic bodies: Nagaland govt tells SC
348.article_body: The Nagaland government informed the Supreme Court on Tuesday that it has agreed to implement 33% reservation for women in civic bodies. The state government told a bench of Justices SK Kaul and M Sundresh that a resolution was adopted in this regard on March 9. The court had earlier criticised the Nagaland government over delay in enforcing the reservation.

349.title: PCMC's 4th 'Jansamvad Sabha' gets 136 complaints on civic issues
