349.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation's (PCMC) fourth 'Jansamvad Sabha' received 136 complaints from citizens, most of which were related to water shortage, followed by concerns about choked drainage lines and poor roads. The forum, meant to address civic complaints and suggestions, was held simultaneously at eight zonal offices. "We're trying to popularise...Jan Sabhas," a PCMC official said.

350.title: Education Ministry seeks report on violence in JNU on Ram Navami
350.article_body: The Ministry of Education has sought a report from JNU regarding a clash between students' groups on the occasion of Ram Navami, a senior MoE official said. Two groups of students clashed at the university's Kaveri Hostel allegedly over serving non-vegetarian food on Ram Navami. The JNU administration on Monday informed students that violence on campus won't be tolerated.

351.title: Kerala worker who left CPI(M) union kills self, alleges threat from party
351.article_body: A 49-year-old worker, who had left CPI(M)'s trade union wing, ended his life in Kerala's Thrissur district, police said. He left a note that stated he had faced threat to life from local CPI(M) leadership. "He had opposed corruption in the organisation...When more workers decided to leave the organisation...CPI(M) leaders raised a threat to his life," the deceased's brother said.

352.title: Requested govt to reduce COVID-19 booster gap to 6 months: Adar Poonawalla
352.article_body: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla has said, "We've appealed to the government on how to reduce [the gap between COVID-19 vaccine dose 2 and booster dose] to six months, will propose the six-month gap." He said, "Vaccination right now is a bit slow...because we've this rule you have to wait for nine months between dose 2 and 3."

353.title: Shouldn’t say Hardik Pandya is a bad captain just because he lost his cool: Graeme Swann
353.article_body: Referring to Hardik Pandya getting angry at Mohammad Shami for not attempting a catch during GT-SRH match, Graeme Swann said people shouldn't call Hardik a bad captain just because he lost his cool. "The fact that they didn't score enough runs lost them the game...not Hardik's captaincy," he added. Meanwhile, Matthew Hayden suggested that Shami should've gone for the catch.

354.title: 3 plant saffron flag on a mosque in Bihar's Muzaffarpur, arrested
354.article_body: Bihar Police arrested three people for allegedly planting a saffron flag on a mosque in Bihar's Muzaffarpur on the occasion of Ram Navami. According to police, while a man climbed the mosque to plant the flag, he was cheered by several men riding bikes, flashing swords and hockey sticks. A video of the incident also went viral, police said.

355.title: Am I Nirav Modi or Vijay Mallya?: Amnesty India ex-chief to court
355.article_body: Days after being denied US visit, former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel on Tuesday told a Delhi court that there was nothing to suggest he is a flight risk. "Am I some Nirav Modi or Vijay Mallya?" said Tanveer Ahmed Mir, Patel's lawyer. He argued that Patel had earlier gone to Bangladesh and returned.

356.title: CoinSwitch disables all crypto purchase options on its app
356.article_body: Indian crypto exchange CoinSwitch Kuber has disabled all modes of payments for purchasing cryptocurrency on its platform. On its app, Indian Rupee (INR) deposits through UPI and other modes, including bank transfers, have been paused, effectively leaving no mode to load the app's wallet to buy cryptocurrency, Moneycontrol reported. CoinSwitch hasn't issued an official statement on the move yet.

357.title: Mahesh Babu & I were nervous about Sitara's 1st music video: Namrata
357.article_body: Mahesh Babu and Namrata Shirodkar's daughter Sitara made her music video debut with a special song titled, 'Penny', from 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata'. Namrata, talking about her daughter's music video debut, said, "We were all nervous because it was her first attempt in a professional set-up." "I think it worked out just amazing for everyone. She was phenomenal," Namrata added.

358.title: DC are moving in right direction, team environment is good: Shardul
358.article_body: DC all-rounder Shardul Thakur has said the franchise is moving in the right direction despite losing two of their four games in the ongoing IPL season. "The environment within the team is quite good...We have great depth in our batting," he added. DC, who defeated KKR on Sunday, will play their next game against RCB on April 16.

359.title: Charan reacts to Salman's 'why our films aren't doing well in South' comment
359.article_body: Ram Charan has reacted to Salman Khan's statement wherein he said, "I wonder why our films are not doing well in...South. Their films are doing so well here." "I believe it's not Salman Ji's fault or some film's fault, it's writing; it's...director who has to transcend...boundaries," Charan said, adding, "Every writer should write movies like Vijayendra Prasad (RRR) or Rajamouli."

360.title: Where is the FIR?: Ex-AAP Himachal chief on 'misbehaviour' allegations
360.article_body: Former Himachal Pradesh AAP chief Anup Kesari, who recently joined BJP, denied AAP's allegations against him of "misbehaviour" against women and said, "Show me the complaint and the complainant." "Is there any proof? Is there any FIR? I rose through the ranks in that party, and when I quit, I got this shabby treatment," he added.

361.title: Sidhu's wife Navjot Kaur hospitalised, to undergo surgery for stone removal
361.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu's wife Navjot Kaur Sidhu has been hospitalised in Amritsar after she was seriously ill for the past two days. Navjot Kaur will undergo surgery for the removal of a stone on Tuesday, a spokesperson of the cricketer-turned-politician said. She's a former Amritsar East MLA and campaigned actively in the recent Punjab Assembly polls.

362.title: J'khand ropeway rescue operation ends after 40 hours; 3 dead, all others rescued
362.article_body: The rescue operation in the ropeway cable car collision incident in Jharkhand's Deoghar district ended on Tuesday after nearly 40 hours when all the remaining passengers were evacuated from the trolleys by IAF helicopters. The death toll in the accident reached three after two persons fell while they were being rescued. According to Deoghar DC, several people have sustained injuries.

363.title: Don't care about my weight, I'm perfect the way I am: Selena Gomez
363.article_body: Singer Selena Gomez, on her TikTok Stories, has said she doesn't care about her weight because "people bi**h about it anyway". "'You're too small,' 'you're too big,' 'that doesn't fit.' 'Meh meh meh meh'," she added. "Bi**h, I'm perfect the way I am," she further said. Selena stated she tries to stay "skinny", however, Selena added she had fast food.

364.title: Maha govt’s image would’ve been different if Pawar was CM: State Cong leader
364.article_body: Maharashtra Minister and Congress leader Yashomati Thakur said that the government’s image would have been different if NCP chief Sharad Pawar had been made the CM of the state. "Sharad Pawar had been the CM of Maharashtra four times but today in this hour of need we want him again to guide us," she added.

365.title: France sends forensic experts to probe Russian war crimes in Ukraine
365.article_body: French police officers and forensic experts arrived in Ukraine on Monday to help investigate alleged war crimes in the country by invading Russian forces. This comes after hundreds of civilian bodies were discovered in towns around Ukraine's capital Kyiv. The Russian Defence Ministry dismissed the French team and said that it could not "count on an impartial investigation".

366.title: Had to learn from our past mistakes: Pooran on SRH's 8-wicket win vs GT
366.article_body: Following SRH's eight-wicket win against GT in IPL 2022, SRH wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran said his side knew that they would have to build important partnerships while chasing the 163-run target. "We as a batting group knew that we just had to learn from our mistakes in the past," he added. SRH scored 168/2 in 19.1 overs.

367.title: S Korea's SK considers investing in Bill Gates' TerraPower
367.article_body: South Korea's SK Group is considering investing in small-sized nuclear reactors and Bill Gates' TerraPower is one of the potential candidates. Bloomberg reported citing the Chosun Ilbo newspaper that SK had been in talks with TerraPower and would take a 10% stake in the company. Founded in 2006, TerraPower plans to build its first reactor in Wyoming by 2028.

368.title: Gang held for robbing people at Hyd rly station; 45 gm gold seized
368.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Tuesday tweeted that it has arrested a gang that allegedly robbed people of goods and money at a railway station in Hyderabad's Shadnagar. The police added that they have also seized items, including about 45 gram of gold, and some cash from the accused. Furthermore, the police shared pictures of the seized items and accused persons.

369.title: Army officer arrested for leaking answer keys of recruitment exam in Pune
369.article_body: The CBI's Pune unit on Monday arrested a Lieutenant Colonel and a sepoy of the Army Ordnance Corps (AOC) in connection with the alleged leaking of answer keys for an Army recruitment examination. The accused allegedly demanded and accepted money from candidates in the recruitment process for various civilian Group 'C' posts through the examination held in Pune in 2019.

370.title: Central teams unearth excess stock of soyabean, mustard seeds in MP
370.article_body: Central government teams have unearthed large hoardings of soyabean and mustard seeds in Dewas, Shajapur and Guna districts of Madhya Pradesh, Consumer Affairs Ministry informed on Tuesday. Besides, excess quantities of edible oils were also found in Maharashtra and Rajasthan, the ministry added. The Centre has also sent teams for inspection in UP, West Bengal, Telangana, Gujarat and Delhi.

371.title: Long-distance routes are increasing tax burden on PMPML: Ajit Pawar
371.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Sunday backed Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited's (PMPML) decision to shut down services in rural regions, stating that it may continue to suffer financial losses otherwise. He said that long-distance routes are putting a greater tax burden on PMPML. "PMPML's service is...cheaper than ST buses. But...[this is] impacting PMPML," Pawar added.

372.title: Govt will send elderly in old age homes on 'tirth yatra': Delhi CM
372.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said his government will send senior citizens living in old age homes in the capital on 'tirth yatra' free of cost. The CM inaugurated Delhi's fourth old age home 'Baba Sahab Dr Bhim Rao Ambedkar Senior Citizen Home', but said, "I pray to god we do not have to build such homes."

373.title: New Pakistan PM responds to PM Modi on Twitter, says, 'Let's secure peace'
373.article_body: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif replied to PM Narendra Modi after he congratulated him on his appointment and tweeted, "Thank you Premier Narendra Modi for felicitations. Pakistan desires peaceful & cooperative ties with India." "Peaceful settlement of outstanding disputes including Jammu & Kashmir is indispensable...Let's secure peace and focus on socio-economic development," Sharif added.

374.title: Skydiver hits ground at 201 kmh after 13,500ft fall in US; pic viral after she survives
374.article_body: A 35-year-old skydiver in US' Virginia survived after her parachute got tangled round her leg and she smashed into the ground at 201 kmh. Jordan Hatmaker, during her 13,500-foot fall last November, had hit the ground 20 seconds after pulling her release cord. She suffered a broken back, leg and ankle, remaining conscious throughout the entire ordeal, it was revealed.

375.title: Ranbir-Alia's reported wedding not postponed, told to switch off my phone: Rahul Bhatt
375.article_body: Contrary to reports that Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's reported wedding has been postponed, Alia's half-brother Rahul said the wedding is happening. "That report misquoted me...I can assure you it will happen before...20th of April," Rahul was quoted as saying by Hindustan Times. He revealed he has been advised to switch off his phone to avoid giving out information.

376.title: Bengaluru woman held for killing husband with iron rod
376.article_body: A 48-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly murdering her husband in the Sunkadakatte area of Bengaluru. The accused, Varalakshmi, allegedly attacked her husband, Umesh (52), with repeated blows on his head with an iron rod leading to the man's death. The couple was married for around 28 years and used to have frequent arguments over domestic issues, police said.

377.title: 3 injured in stampede-like situation at Tirumala shrine in Andhra Pradesh
377.article_body: At least three people were injured in a stampede-like situation at Sri Venkateswara Swamy Temple's ticket counters in Andhra Pradesh's Tirumala. A large crowd of pilgrims gathered at the ticket counters in the shrine for Sarvadarshan tickets. "There was a huge rush at three token counters...pilgrims were allowed directly into the compartments of Tirumala for darshan," an official said.

378.title: You should give such players more time: Manjrekar on Ruturaj's form
378.article_body: Talking about CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad's form in the ongoing IPL season, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said the 25-year-old should be given the "long rope" as he has shown "long-term form" in previous editions. "It's not like he scored in just one or two innings," he added. Ruturaj has scored 0, 1, 1, and 16 in his four innings this season.

379.title: Telangana farmers dump paddy outside BJP MP’s house
379.article_body: Farmers dumped paddy in front of the residence of BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri in Telangana's Nizamabad on Tuesday to protest against the Centre over its refusal to buy rice from the state. "He [Dharmapuri] is hiding in Delhi and has betrayed us as he's yet to take cognisance of paddy procurement issue. Centre must procure from us," said the protesters.

380.title: Pune civic body extends garden timings by 1 hr in morning & evening
380.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation on Monday tweeted that it has extended the timing for gardens by an hour in the morning and evening. The timings for the gardens, including the Chhatrapati Sambhaji Park Aquarium, will now be from 6 am to 11 am and 4 pm to 9 pm. "We covered you in this scorching heat!" the civic body said.

381.title: Delhi farmhouse caretaker lynched on suspicion of slaughtering cows
381.article_body: A caretaker in a farmhouse in Dwarka's Chhawla area was lynched and two people were injured after a group of 10-15 men attacked them on suspicion that they were slaughtering cows, police said. The caretaker, 40-year-old Rajaram, was killed in the incident on Monday. Five people have been arrested from the spot and two FIRs have been registered, police said.

382.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts from 10 am to 5 pm tomorrow
382.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited has said that several areas in the city will be facing power interruptions tomorrow, i.e. on Wednesday due to maintenance works. According to BESCOM, Bengaluru's North zone, South zone and West zone will face power cuts from 10 am-5 pm. The affected areas include Amaravathi Layout, Sharada Nagar, Mallathahalli Layout and Vigneshwara Nagar, among others.

383.title: Singer Neha Bhasin's brother gets married to his girlfriend who escaped from Ukraine
383.article_body: Singer Neha Bhasin's brother Anubhav Bhasin shared photos of his wedding with his girlfriend who escaped from Ukraine amid war. The couple got married in Delhi. Anna Horodetska left Ukraine with some clothes and a coffee maker, given by her grandmother as a wedding present and on her arrival in India, photos of Anubhav proposing to her had gone viral.

384.title: Anderson shares before-after pic ahead of his 23rd year in professional cricket
384.article_body: Pacer James Anderson took to Twitter to share a before-after picture of himself before starting his 23rd year in professional cricket. Anderson shared a collage of himself from 2002 and 2022. He can be seen wearing first-class cricket jersey of Lancashire in the pictures. "Highlights are now grey...but...enthusiasm is the same! Can’t wait to get going with Lancashire," he wrote.

385.title: Uma Bharti gives up food after not being allowed to perform ritual at shrine
385.article_body: After the ASI denied permission to BJP leader Uma Bharti to perform ritual at Madhya Pradesh's Someshwar Mahadev temple on Monday, she decided to give up food. "I am deeply anguished...To control my emotions and to have peace of mind, I have given up food till I can worship at Someshwar Mahadev temple," Bharti told PTI.

386.title: Delhi woman kills alcoholic husband, dumps sack with body in park with son's help
386.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly strangulating her 32-year-old husband after drugging him in Delhi. She later took her 13-year-old son's help to stuff the body in a sack, carry it on his bicycle to a park and dump it there. She told police her husband was an unemployed alcoholic and used to torture her and their two children.

387.title: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala sells stake in Escorts, stock price falls
387.article_body: Agriculture machinery company Escorts' share price was down over 3% on Tuesday, a day after billionaire ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala sold his stake in the company. Jhunjhunwala reportedly held 75 lakh equity shares, or 5.68%, in the company as of December 31, 2022. His name is now missing from the list of individual shareholders with a 1% or more stake.

388.title: Sonal Chauhan joins Prabhas, Saif in Om Raut's 'Adipurush'
388.article_body: Sonal Chauhan, who has appeared in films like 'Bbuddah Hoga Terra Baap' and 'Paltan', has joined the cast of Om Raut's 'Adipurush'. Speaking about the upcoming project, she said, "It's a very different world from the kind of work I've done so far. I'm sure the audience will enjoy...'Adipurush'." The film also stars Prabhas, Saif Ali Khan and Kriti Sanon.

389.title: Japan freezes assets of 398 Russians, including Putin’s daughters
389.article_body: Japan has announced new sanctions on Russia over the Ukraine invasion, which includes freezing the assets of 398 Russian citizens. The individuals targeted by the sanctions include Russian President Vladimir Putin's two daughters and the wife of Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov. Earlier, the US, the UK, and the European Union had imposed sanctions on Putin's daughters.

390.title: Govt making sincere efforts to bring positive changes in people’s lives: PM Modi
390.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that his government is making sincere efforts to bring positive changes in the lives of citizens through various welfare schemes. PM Modi wrote this in his reply to a beneficiary of the ‘Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana’. PM stated that his government is committed to the goal of providing houses to every needy family.

391.title: 50-yr-old man shot dead by unidentified men in Delhi's Sangam Vihar
391.article_body: A 50-year-old man was shot dead by at least nine to ten unidentified persons in the Sangam Vihar area of Delhi on Sunday. According to the police, mutual enmity could be the reason behind the killing of the man. An argument broke out between the victim and some people a few days back, Times Now quoted an eyewitness as saying.

392.title: 72% Indian working women reject roles that don’t allow flexible working: Survey
392.article_body: Seven in 10 working women in India have quit or are considering quitting their jobs this year at companies that don't allow them to work flexibly, LinkedIn research involving 2,266 Indian respondents has found. While 72% of women are rejecting roles that don't allow flexible working, 88% of women had to take pay cuts to work flexibly, the survey found.

393.title: Woman punches and slaps 9-month-old baby, slams the child on bed in J&K
393.article_body: A woman has been arrested after a video showing her punching and slapping her nine-month-old baby in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district surfaced on social media. The woman can be seen slamming the child on the bed in the video. Police said that the child has been handed over to her husband.

394.title: It is a win-win situation: Morgan on going unsold in IPL mega auction
394.article_body: Talking about going unsold in the IPL mega auction despite leading KKR to IPL 2021's final, Eoin Morgan said he considers it as a "win-win" situation. "Once I start playing again, it doesn't stop until after the T20 World Cup. I have had a lovely period at home," added Morgan. Shreyas Iyer replaced Morgan as KKR captain.

395.title: 32-yr-old man held with 207 kg ganja in Kolkata's Cooch Behar
395.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested by Narcotics Control Bureau of Kolkata on Monday for storing 207 kg of ganja at his home in Cooch Behar. The accused, a resident of Patchhara village, allegedly procured the drug from Cooch Behar and sold it to needy customers in different parts of Kolkata. Police also seized over ₹1 lakh cash from the accused.

396.title: Tripura Police arrests 2 Bangladeshi women who entered India illegally
396.article_body: The Tripura Police on Monday arrested two Bangladeshi women who allegedly infiltrated the Indian territory and an Indian accomplice, officials said. The accused were identified as Bangladeshi women who allegedly entered the Indian soil in Tripura four days ago in search of jobs. Later, they came in touch with a 27-year-old woman from Bagma of Gomati district.

397.title: WHO investigating 2 new sub-variants of Omicron
397.article_body: The WHO has said it is tracking a few dozen cases of two new sub-variants of Omicron strain of the coronavirus, BA.4 and BA.5, to assess whether they are more infectious or dangerous. The WHO said it had begun tracking them because of their "additional mutations that need to be further studied to understand their impact on immune escape potential".

398.title: OnePlus TV 43 Y1S Pro launched with 4K UHD display & smart connectivity
398.article_body: OnePlus has launched the new OnePlus TV 43 Y1S Pro featuring 4K UHD display with MEMC feature, 24W Dolby Audio, and smart features including connectivity to the OnePlus products ecosystem and OxygenPlay 2.0. The smart TV is available on Amazon, OnePlus.in, OnePlus Experience Stores and other partner stores.

399.title: Second suspect arrested in West Bengal's Hanskhali rape case
399.article_body: A second suspect was arrested in connection with the alleged rape of a minor girl in the Hanskhali area of West Bengal's Nadia district on Tuesday. According to the police, he is a friend of the main suspect in the case. "He (second suspect) was present at the birthday party. We have found discrepancies in his versions," an official said.

400.title: Once you cross the line, it's just bat vs ball: Hussey on facing Plessis-led RCB
400.article_body: On facing some of their ex-players in the match against RCB, CSK batting coach Michael Hussey said they have "great memories" with players like Faf du Plessis, who's leading RCB this year, but once a player "crosses the line it's just bat versus ball". He added, "Hopefully, we can come out on top...it'll be nice to shake hands afterward."
